text: I can't stop worrying about my son's cough. What if it's something serious?
My mind jumps to the worst case every time.
Can you help me check the facts about this worry?
I know I should worry less but I can't switch it off.
Is there a way to contain the worrying to a specific time?
My shoulders are so tense. Something quick?
What if this worry is actually me being a good dad?
Two options: more relaxation or a distraction?
Remind me of your limits—you can't diagnose, right?
Save: check the facts + scheduled worry time helped.
